title: 'It's been manic': Stephen Jones on last-minute Wales call-up to replace Rob Howley – video
text:
Stephen Jones has spoken for the first time as Wales backs coach after he replaced former coach Rob Howley. Howley, 48, was sent home to assist with an investigation into potential betting breaches. The former Wales fly-half will be taking on the side’s attacking duties as he and Warren Gatland look to build on a successful year for the Six Nations champions. Jones had already been named as part of a new post-World Cup Wales coaching team under Wayne Pivac.

• Wales’ first-half blitz ensures victory over Georgia in Rugby World Cup
description: The former Wales fly-half has been brought in ahead of schedule after Rob Howley was sent home for a suspected betting breach
